text: Valley Center is a city in Sedgwick County, Kansas, United States. It is a suburb of Wichita. In 2020, 7,340 people lived there. ==History== Valley Center was incorporated on September 29, 1885. It was named for its place in the valley of the Arkansas River. ==Geography== Valley Center is at (37.829719, -97.369341). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it land. Valley Center is two miles west of combined Interstate 135, U.S. Route 81, and K-15. ==People== Valley Center is part of the Wichita, KS Metropolitan Statistical Area. ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 7,340 people, 2,620 households, and 1,998 families living there. Of the households, 76.1% owned their home and 23.9% rented their home. The median age was 36.0 years. Of the people, 86.1% were White, 1.4% were Black, 1.0% were Native American, 0.6% were Asian, 2.2% were from some other race, and 8.6% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 7.9% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 6,822 people, 2,484 households, and 1,862 families living in Valley Center. ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * City of Valley Center * Valley Center - Chamber of Commerce ;Schools * USD 262, local school district * USD 262 School District Boundary Map , KDOT ;Historical * Theorosa's Bridge ;Maps * Valley Center City Map , KDOT Category:Cities in Sedgwick County, Kansas
title: Valley Center, Kansas
